x10.mongo.yak
Class YakList

x10.lang.Any
  java.util.AbstractCollection
      java.util.AbstractList
          java.util.ArrayList
              x10.mongo.yak.YakList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable
public class YakList
extends java.util.ArrayList

A small variation on an ArrayList. It mainly provides a multiple-element quasi-literal notation, which is useful for BSON objects. (new YakList()) & a & b & c & d is a list with elements a, b, c, and d.

Method Detail

operator&

public YakList operator&(x10.lang.Any a)
Declaration: operator&(a:x10.lang.Any): x10.mongo.yak.YakList{self==this(:x10.mongo.yak.YakList)}.
Add an element to this (mutating this), and return this.
Operators which mutate their arguments are generally bad style.
The purpose of this one -- which may or may not excuse the bad style -- is to
provide a form of list literal.
(new YakList()) & a & b & c & d  is a list
with elements a, b, c, and d.

A small variation on an ArrayList.
It mainly provides a multiple-element quasi-literal notation, which is useful for
BSON objects.
(new YakList()) & a & b & c & d  is a list
with elements a, b, c, and d.
